intro: [WRONG START] Embilia javanica, commonly known as the Java embelia, is a small evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves and small, white flowers. The plant produces tiny, fleshy berries that are typically red when mature. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. Its botanical features make it a valuable species in traditional medicine and ecological studies.
